title: Casualties of the September 11 attacks
summary: During the September 11 2001 attacks, 2,977 people were killed, 19 hijackers committed murderâ€“suicide, and more than 6,000 others were injured.[1][2] Of the 2,996 total deaths (including the terrorists), 2,763 were in the World Trade Center and the surrounding area, 189 were at the Pentagon,[3][4] and 44 were in Pennsylvania. These deaths included 265 on the four planes. The attacks remain the deadliest terrorist act in world history.[5]
